metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1786 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Page Loading implementation in WebKit in Apple iOS before 9.3 andSafari before 9.1 mishandles HTTP responses with a 3xx (aka redirection)status code, which allows remote attackers to spoof the displayed URL,bypass the Same Origin Policy, and obtain sensitive cached information viaa crafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1786` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.10.9-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkit2gtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.9-1ubuntu1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
